column4: How does ssh work?  I need help.  I have openssh-server installed, don't know what to do next.
connect to your machine from an ssh client!
(maybe port forward if you need to on your router)
From another linux machine? from windows? what?
ssh user@host (host is likely an IP)
ok, thanks.  now, how do I know my ip address?  It's going to be lan, so whatsmyip.net will show me the wrong thing, right?
e17 isn't stable yet, so its not in the repos
php doesn't run as a daemon.  What are you tryng to accomplish?

I don't know what I am doing.  All I know is that I remember turning it off at somepoint, and it doesn't work right now.  If I recall correctly, it was a terminal based app, and it wasn't just for php, you used it for a lot of stuff.
I can not remember why I turned it off.
Alright.  Where are you trying to use it currently? with apache?
Alright, uh, do you have libapache2-mod-php5 installed?

I don't know what I have installed.  All I know is that It used to work,  I no longerneeded it, and turned it off without uninstalling anything.  Now I need it again, and don't remember where I turned it off.
alright, you might've done: `sudo a2dismod php5` and then to reverse that you do: sudo a2enmod php5
It was a appy thingy.  It gave a list of stuff, and php was on it, and I deselected it.  It wasn't a single line that did something.
I unfortunately have absolutely no idea what you're talking about
